title: Profiles got rid of my bookmarks and history.
content: When I opened the browser, it prompted me about profiles. I clicked on it out of curiosity. However, when I tried to back out of it because I don't need any profiles, it created one anyway. Then whenever I would open the browser, it would prompt me to choose a profile. I don't need any profiles, and it was annoying that there was an extra step. There was the button to turn off the choose profile screen, but I guess I was steadfast in my annoyance, so I deleted the profiles to make it unable to show up. This, however, signed me out of Firefox, and when I logged back in, none of my bookmarks or history were there. I tried the sync option because I at least still had my history on the app, but it did not work. Frankly, I don't care, and I'll just make the bookmarks again. And maybe it should have made sense that deleting the profiles would delete everything with it. But I still think it's insanely stupid to not be able to back out of creating a profile. Took up my time and simultaneously gave me more work to do. I don't want any help or support just needed to voice my feelings.

title: Mouse scroll wheel "effects" are driving me nuts
content:
I admit, I don't read about updates so I don't know when Firefox did all these "enhancements"...but I'd love to know how to turn my mouse wheel BACK into a "scroll through the page" only function. I hate it auto opening links, I hate it scrolling through tabs. I suspect it of doing other "helpful" functions...and I can't even find the right words to do a search for this. The only applicable setting I found is "autoscroll"...which is turned off in my preferences...and which the browser STILL does.

All I want is for my wheel to scroll through the page...under my control. No auto-stuff. There's no setting for this in my mouse controls, as far as I've been able to determine, and it didn't used to do this. It must be in a Firefox update. Is this even possible any longer? Or am I, after decades with Firefox, going to have to change browsers? At this point, I've had far too many important operations disrupted and even fouled by this "helpful" change.

Pleeeease help?

title: mTLS not working on newer version (>128, Debian)
content:
Hi,

I am using mTLS to authenticate my computers reaching websites I manage. I imported client certificate on firefox and cloudflare is checking if the client is sending the right certificate. I am using Debian and Windows. On Debian (13), everything was working great until the version 140 ESR. I don't know why but the client certificate is not sent to cloudflare, sometime it is (when CTRL+F5) but no CSS is rendered. So I can't reach my websites. Firefox is still asking for the right certificate to send but that's all. This is weird because on the same version on Windows, with the same certificate, it is working. I tried newer version (144.0.2) on Debian but it is not working. The version I use at the moment is 128.14.0esr. Cloudflare is blocking the traffic because no certificate is sent. If I disable the rule, it is working.

Could someone help me? Feel free to ask for more details.

Hugo
creator: hugo.racape

title: Website Integrity and Secure Browsing
content:
At Fonster Partners, our commitment to quality extends beneath the surface of our products, applying directly to the operational integrity and security of our website. We understand that a reliable browsing environment is the foundation of trust. To ensure this, our entire website operates exclusively on HTTPS, utilizing modern SSL/TLS encryption to secure the connection between your browser and our server for all data transmission. Our digital infrastructure is housed in a protected environment equipped with robust firewalls and active intrusion detection systems. 

                 We maintain a rigorous schedule of software and security patch updates across all platform components, ensuring that the pages showcasing our aluminium window systems, glass railings, and LED mirrors are hardened against emerging threats. This dedication to digital health means you can confidently browse our services, knowing that the online environment Fonster Partners provides is stable, private, and secure.
